data.value: Enter the number of passwords to store for reuse check

data.name: plEnableBannedList.Text

data.name: plEnableIPChecking.Text
data.value: Enable IP Address Checking

data.value: Sets whether IP address is checked during login

data.name: MembershipResetLinkValidity.ErrorMessage
data.value: Reset link timeouts must be an integer greater than 0 and less than 10000

data.name: AdminMembershipResetLinkValidity.ErrorMessage
data.value: Administrator reset link timeouts must be an integer greater than 0 and less than 10000.

data.name: MembershipNumberPasswords.ErrorMessage
data.value: Number of passwords to store must be an integer greater than or equal to 0 and less than 10000.

data.name: MembershipDaysBeforePasswordReuse.ErrorMessage
data.value: Number of Days Before Password Reuse must be an integer greater than or equal to 0 and less than 10000.

data.name: AutoAccountUnlockDuration.ErrorMessage
data.value: Auto account unlock duration must be an integer greater than or equal to 0 and less than 1000.

data.name: AsyncTimeout.ErrorMessage
data.value: Time before timeout must be an integer greater than or equal to 90 and less than 10000.

data.name: PasswordExpiry.ErrorMessage
data.value: Password expiry must be an integer greater than or equal to 0 and less than 10000.

data.name: PasswordExpiryReminder.ErrorMessage
data.value: Password expiry reminder must be an integer greater than or equal to 0 and less than 10000.

data.name: None.Text
data.value: None

data.value: Private

data.name: Public.Text
data.value: Public

data.name: Verified.Text
data.value: Verified

data.name: Standard.Text
data.value: Standard

data.name: Custom.Text
data.value: Custom

data.name: plUserRegistration.Text
data.value: User Registration

data.name: plUserRegistration.Help
data.value: Select the type of user registration, if any, allowed for this site. Private registration requires users to be authorized by the Site Administrator before gaining access to the Registered Users role. Public registration provides immediate access and Verified registration requires verification of the email address provided.

data.name: NoEmail.Text
data.value: The "Email" field, at minimum, must be included.

data.name: NoDisplayName.Text
data.value: You have selected the Require Unique Display Name option but you have not included the Display Name in the list of fields.

data.name: ContainsDuplicateAddresses.Text
data.value: The user base of this site contains duplicate email addresses. If you want to use email addresses as user names you must fix those entries first.

data.name: registrationFormTypeLabel.Help
data.value: Select the type of Registration Form that you want to use.

data.name: registrationFormTypeLabel.Text
data.value: Registration Form Type

data.name: Security_DisplayNameFormat.Help
data.value: Optionally specify a format for display names. The format can include tokens for dynamic substitution such as [FIRSTNAME] [LASTNAME]. If a display name format is specified, the display name will no longer be editable through the user interface.

data.name: Security_DisplayNameFormat.Text
data.value: Display Name Format

data.name: Security_UserNameValidation.Help
data.value: Add your own Validation Expression, which is used to check the validity of the user name provided. If you change this from the default you should update the message that a user would see when they enter an invalid user name using the localization editor in Settings - Site Settings - Languages.

data.name: Security_UserNameValidation.Text
data.value: User Name Validation

data.name: Security_EmailValidation.Help
data.value: Optionally modify the Email Validation Expression which is used to check the validity of the email address provided.

data.name: Security_EmailValidation.Text
data.value: Email Address Validation

data.name: Registration_ExcludeTerms.Help
data.value: You can define a comma-delimited list of terms that a user cannot use in their user name or display name.

data.name: Registration_ExcludeTerms.Text
data.value: Excluded Terms

data.name: plEnableRegisterNotification.Help
data.value: Check this box to send email notification of new user registrations to the Primary Administrator.

data.name: plEnableRegisterNotification.Text
data.value: Receive User Registration Notification

data.name: Registration_UseAuthProviders.Help
data.value: Select this option to use authentication providers during registration. Note that not all providers support this option.

data.name: Registration_UseAuthProviders.Text
data.value: Use Authentication Providers

data.name: Registration_UseProfanityFilter.Help
data.value: Check this box to enforce the profanity filter for the user name and display name fields during registration.

data.name: Registration_UseProfanityFilter.Text
data.value: Use Profanity Filter

data.name: Registration_UseEmailAsUserName.Help
data.value: Check this box to use the email address as the user name. If this option is enabled then the user name entry field will not be shown in the registration form.

data.name: Registration_UseEmailAsUserName.Text
data.value: Use Email Address as Username

data.name: Registration_RequireUniqueDisplayName.Help
data.value: Optionally require users to use a unique display name. If a user chooses a name that already exists then a modified name will be suggested.

data.name: Registration_RequireUniqueDisplayName.Text
data.value: Require Unique Display Name

data.name: Registration_RandomPassword.Help
data.value: Check this box to generate random passwords during registration, rather than displaying a password entry field.

data.name: Registration_RandomPassword.Text
data.value: Use Random Password

data.name: Registration_RequireConfirmPassword.Help
data.value: Check this box to display a password confirmation box on the registration form.

data.name: Registration_RequireConfirmPassword.Text
data.value: Require Password Confirmation

data.name: Security_RequireValidProfile.Help
data.value: Check this box if users must complete all required fields including the User Name, First Name, Last Name, Display Name, Email Address and Password fields during registration.

data.name: Security_RequireValidProfile.Text
data.value: Require a Valid Profile for Registration

data.name: Security_CaptchaRegister.Help
data.value: Indicate whether this site should use CAPTCHA for registration.

data.name: Security_CaptchaRegister.Text
data.value: Use CAPTCHA for Registration

data.name: RequiresUniqueEmail.Help
data.value: Check this box to require each user to provide a unique email address. This prevents users from registering multiple times with the same email address.

data.name: RequiresUniqueEmail.Text
data.value: Requires Unique Email

data.name: PasswordFormat.Help
data.value: The password format.

data.name: PasswordFormat.Text
data.value: Password Format

data.name: PasswordRetrievalEnabled.Help
data.value: Indicates whether users can retrieve their password.

data.name: PasswordRetrievalEnabled.Text
data.value: Password Retrieval Enabled

data.name: PasswordResetEnabledTitle.Help
data.value: Indicates whether or not a user can request their password to be reset. This can only be changed in web.config file.

data.name: PasswordResetEnabledTitle.Text
data.value: Password Reset Enabled

data.name: MinNonAlphanumericCharactersTitle.Help
data.value: Indicates the minimum number of special characters in the password. This can only be changed in web.config file.

data.name: MinNonAlphanumericCharactersTitle.Text
data.value: Min Non Alphanumeric Characters

data.name: RequiresQuestionAndAnswerTitle.Help
data.value: Indicates whether a question and answer system is used as part of the registration process. Can only be changed in web.config file.

data.name: RequiresQuestionAndAnswerTitle.Text
data.value: Requires Question and Answer

data.name: PasswordStrengthRegularExpressionTitle.Help
data.value: The regular expression used to evaluate password complexity from the provider specified in the Provider property. This can only be changed in web.config file by adding/altering the passwordStrengthRegularExpression node of AspNetSqlMembershipProvider. Note: this server validation is different from the password strength meter introduced in 7.1.0 which only advises on password strength, whereas this expression is a requirement for new passwords (if it is defined).

data.name: PasswordStrengthRegularExpressionTitle.Text
data.value: Password Strength Regular Expression

data.name: MaxInvalidPasswordAttemptsTitle.Help
data.value: Indicates the number of times the wrong password can be entered before account is locked. This can only be changed in web.config file.

data.name: MaxInvalidPasswordAttemptsTitle.Text
data.value: Max Invalid Password Attempts

data.name: PasswordAttemptWindowTitle.Help
data.value: Indicates the length of time an account is locked after failed login attempts. Can only be changed in web.config file.

data.name: PasswordAttemptWindowTitle.Text
data.value: Password Attempt Window

data.name: RegistrationSettingsUpdateSuccess.Text
data.value: The registration settings has been updated.

data.name: RegistrationSettingsError.Text
data.value: Could not update the registration settings. Please try later.

data.name: RegistrationSettingsRestoreWarning.Text
data.value: Are you sure you want to cancel your changes?

data.name: registrationFieldsLabel.Help
data.value: You can specify the list of fields you want to include as a comma-delimited list. If this setting is used, this will take precedence over the other settings. The possible fields include user name, email, password, confirm password, display name and all the Profile Properties.

data.name: registrationFieldsLabel.Text
data.value: Registration Fields:

data.name: GlobalSettingsTab.Text
data.value: This is a global settings Tab. Changes to the settings will affect all of your sites.

data.name: GlobalSetting.Text
data.value: This is a global setting. Changes to this setting will affect all of your sites.

data.name: plSSLEnforced.Text
data.value: Mixed Mode

data.name: plSSLEnforced.Help
data.value: Check the box if pages marked as insecure should not be accessible through HTTPS and should always be directed to HTTP.

data.name: plSSLURL.Text
data.value: SSL URL

data.name: plSSLURL.Help
data.value: Optionally specify a URL which will be used for secure connections for this site. This is only necessary if you do not have an SSL Certificate installed for your standard site URL. An example would be a shared hosting account where the host provides you with a Shared SSL URL.

data.name: plSTDURL.Text
data.value: Standard URL

data.name: plSTDURL.Help
data.value: If an SSL URL is specified above, then specify the Standard URL for unsecure connections.

data.name: plShowCriticalErrors.Help
data.value: This setting determines if error messages sent via the error querystring parameter should be shown inline in the page.

data.name: plShowCriticalErrors.Text
data.value: Show Critical Errors on Screen

data.name: plDebugMode.Help
data.value: Check this box to run the installation in "debug mode". This causes various parts of the application to write more verbose error logs etc. Note: This may lead to performance degradation.

data.name: plDebugMode.Text
data.value: Debug Mode

data.name: plRememberMe.Text
data.value: Enable Remember Me on Login Control

data.name: plRememberMe.Help
data.value: Check this box to display the Remember Login check box on the login control that allows users to stay logged in for multiple visits.

data.name: plAutoAccountUnlock.Text
data.value: Auto-Unlock Accounts After (Minutes)

data.name: plAutoAccountUnlock.Help
data.value: After an account is locked out due to unsuccessful login attempts, it can be automatically unlocked with a successful authentication after a certain period of time has elapsed. Enter the number of minutes to wait until the account can be automatically unlocked. Enter "0" to disable the auto-unlock feature.

data.name: plAsyncTimeout.Help
data.value: Set a value that indicates the time, in seconds, before asynchronous postbacks time out if no response is received, the value should between 90-9999 seconds.

data.name: plAsyncTimeout.Text
data.value: Time Before Timeout (Seconds)

data.name: plMaxUploadSize.Help
data.value: Maximum size of files that can be uploaded to the site. The minimum is 12 MB.

data.name: plMaxUploadSize.Text
data.value: Max Upload Size (MB)

data.name: maxUploadSize.Error
data.value: Maximum upload size must be between 12 and {0}

data.name: plFileExtensions.Help
data.value: Enter the extensions (separated by commas) for files that can be uploaded to the site by site administrators.

data.name: plFileExtensions.Text
data.value: Allowable File Extensions:

data.name: OtherSettingsUpdateSuccess.Text
data.value: Settings have been updated.

data.name: OtherSettingsError.Text
data.value: Could not update settings. Please try later.

data.name: OtherSettingsRestoreWarning.Text
data.value: Are you sure you want to cancel your changes?

data.value: BULLETINS

data.name: BulletinsDoNotExist.Text
data.value: There are currently no Security Bulletins for DotNetNuke Platform version {0}.

data.name: BulletinsExist.Text
data.value: There are currently {0} Security Bulletins for DotNetNuke Platform version {1}:

data.name: RequestFailed_Admin.Text
data.value: Could Not Connect To {0}. You Should Verify The Source Address Is Valid And That Your Hosting Provider Has Configured Their Proxy Server Settings Correctly.

data.name: RequestFailed_User.Text
data.value: News Feed Is Not Available At This Time. Error message:

data.value: AUDIT CHECKS

data.name: TabScannerCheck.Text
data.value: SCANNER CHECK

data.name: TabSuperuserActivity.Text
data.value: SUPERUSER ACTIVITY

data.name: SuperUserActivityExplaination.Text
data.value: Below are the SuperUser activities. Look for suspicious activities here. Pay close attention to the Creation and Last Login Dates.

data.name: Username.Text
data.value: USERNAME

data.name: CreatedDate.Text
data.value: CREATED DATE

data.name: LastLogin.Text
data.value: LAST LOGIN

data.name: LastActivityDate.Text
data.value: LAST ACTIVITY DATE

data.name: SecurityCheck.Text
data.value: SECURITY CHECK

data.name: Result.Text
data.value: RESULT

data.name: Notes.Text
data.value: NOTES

data.name: AuditChecks.Text
data.value: Audit Checks

data.name: SuperuserActivity.Text
data.value: Super User Activity

data.name: CheckDebugFailure.Text
data.value: debug is set to true - consider editing web.config and setting it to false (or use the configuration manager)

data.name: CheckDebugReason.Text
data.value: If the debug attribute is set to true it impacts performance and can reveal security exception details useful to hackers

data.name: CheckDebugSuccess.Text
data.value: Not in debug mode. This setting depends on debug value in web.config file.

data.name: cmdCheck.Text
data.value: Check

data.name: cmdSearch.Text
data.value: Search

data.name: plSearchTerm.Text
data.value: Search term

data.name: cmdModifiedFiles.Text
data.value: Find Recently Modified Files

data.name: ScannerChecks.Text
data.value: Search Filesystem and Database

data.name: AuditExplanation.Text
data.value: Note: the system automatically perform scans for security best practices

data.name: Authorized.Header
data.value: Authorized

data.name: CheckTracing.Text
data.value: Tracing is set to true - consider editing web.config and setting it to false (or use the configuration manager)

data.name: CheckTracingReason.Text
data.value: If the tracing attribute is set to true it allows potential hackers to view site activity

data.name: CheckTracingSuccess.Text
data.value: Tracing is not enabled

data.name: CreatedDate.Header
data.value: Created date

data.name: DisplayName.Header
data.value: Display name

data.name: Email.Header
data.value: Email

data.name: FirstName.Header
data.value: First name

data.name: LastActivityDate.Header
data.value: Last Activity Date

data.name: LastLogin.Header
data.value: Last login

data.name: LastName.Header
data.value: Last name

data.name: Username.Header
data.value: Username

data.name: CheckBiographyFailure.Text
data.value: The field is richtext. Spammers may put links to their website in their biography field. The field type can be changed in Settings -> Site Settings -> Site Behavior -> User Profiles

data.name: CheckBiographyReason.Text
data.value: The biography field is a common target for spammers as they can add links/html to it. In DNN 7.2.0 this was changed to a multiline textbox which removes this risk.

data.name: CheckBiographySuccess.Text
data.value: The field is not enabled or is a multiline textbox

data.name: CheckRarelyUsedSuperuserFailure.Text
data.value: We have found 1 or more superuser accounts that have not been logged in or had activity in six months. Consider deleting them as a best practice

data.name: CheckRarelyUsedSuperuserReason.Text
data.value: Superuser accounts are the most powerful DNN accounts. As a best practice these should be limited.

data.name: CheckRarelyUsedSuperuserSuccess.Text
data.value: All superusers are regular users of the system.

data.name: CheckSiteRegistrationFailure.Text
data.value: One or more websites are using public registration

data.name: CheckSiteRegistrationReason.Text
data.value: Sites that have public registration enabled are a prime target for spammers.

data.name: CheckSiteRegistrationSuccess.Text
data.value: All the websites are using non-public registration

data.name: CheckSuperuserOldPasswordFailure.Text
data.value: At least one superuser account has a password that has not been changed in more than 6 months.

data.name: CheckSuperuserOldPasswordReason.Text
data.value: Superuser accounts are the most powerful DNN accounts. As a best practice these accounts should have their passwords changed regularly.

data.name: CheckSuperuserOldPasswordSuccess.Text
data.value: No superuser has a password older than 6 months.

data.name: CheckUnexpectedExtensionsFailure.Text
data.value: An asp or php extension was found - these may be harmless, but sometimes indicate a site has been exploited and these files are tools. We recommend you evaluate these files carefully.

data.name: CheckUnexpectedExtensionsReason.Text
data.value: DNN is an asp.net web application. Under normal circumstances other server application extensions such as asp and php should not be in use.

data.name: CheckUnexpectedExtensionsSuccess.Text
data.value: No unexpected extensions found

data.name: CheckViewstatemacFailure.Text
data.value: viewstatemac validation is not enabled

data.name: CheckViewstatemacReason.Text
data.value: A view-state MAC is an encrypted version of the hidden variable that a page's view state is persisted to when the page is sent to the browser. When this property is set to true, the encrypted view state is checked to verify that it has not been tampered with on the client.

data.name: CheckViewstatemacSuccess.Text
data.value: The viewstate is protected via the usage of a MAC

data.name: CheckPurpose.Header
data.value: Purpose of the check

data.name: Result.Header
data.value: Result

data.name: Severity.Header
data.value: Severity

data.name: CheckBiographyName.Text
data.value: Check if public profile fields use richtext

data.name: CheckDebugName.Text
data.value: Check Debug status

data.name: CheckRarelyUsedSuperuserName.Text
data.value: Check if superuser accounts are rarely active

data.name: CheckSiteRegistrationName.Text
data.value: Check if site(s) use public registration

data.name: CheckSuperuserOldPasswordName.Text
data.value: Check if superusers are not regularly changing passwords

data.name: CheckTracingName.Text
data.value: Check if asp.net tracing is enabled

data.name: CheckUnexpectedExtensionsName.Text
data.value: Check if asp/php files are found

data.name: CheckDefaultPageName.Text
data.value: Check if default.aspx or default.aspx.cs files have been modified

data.name: CheckDefaultPageFailure.Text
data.value: The default page(s) have been modified. We recommend you evaluate these files carefully, they may be modified by a hacker and may contain malicious code. It is best to compare these files with that from a standard install of your product. Ensure that the DNN version of your current site matches with the standard site prior to comparison. Either remove the malicious code or restore these files from standard installation.

data.name: CheckDefaultPageReason.Text
data.value: DNN use default.aspx to load everything, so all requests will load this file when user browse the site, if someone modify this file, it may cause huge risk.

data.name: CheckDefaultPageSuccess.Text
data.value: The default.aspx and default.aspx.cs pages haven't been modified.

data.name: CheckViewstatemacName.Text
data.value: Check if viewstate is protected

data.name: NoDatabaseResults.Text
data.value: Search term was not found in the database

data.name: NoFileResults.Text
data.value: Search term was not found in any files

data.name: SearchTermRequired.Text
data.value: Search term is required

data.name: CheckTracingFailure.Text
data.value: Tracing is enabled - this allows potential hackers to view site activity.

data.name: Filename.Header
data.value: File Name

data.name: LastModifiedDate.Header
data.value: Last Modification Date

data.name: ModifiedFiles.Text
data.value: Recently Modified Files

data.name: CheckModuleHeaderAndFooterFailure.Text
data.value: There are modules in your system that have header and footer settings, please review them to make sure no phishing code is present.

data.name: CheckModuleHeaderAndFooterName.Text
data.value: Check Modules have Header or Footer settings

data.name: CheckModuleHeaderAndFooterReason.Text
data.value: Hackers may use module's header or footer settings to inject content for phishing attacks.

data.name: CheckModuleHeaderAndFooterSuccess.Text
data.value: No modules were found that had header or footer values configured.

data.name: CheckDiskAccessName.Text
data.value: Checks extra drives/folders access permission outside the website folder

data.name: CheckDiskAccessFailure.Text
data.value: Hackers could access drives/folders outside the website

data.name: CheckDiskAccessReason.Text
data.value: The user which your website is running under has access to drives and folders outside the website location. A hacker could access these files and either read, write, or do both activities.

data.name: CheckDiskAccessSuccess.Text
data.value: Hackers cannot access drives/folders outside the website

data.name: CheckPasswordFormatName.Text
data.value: Check Password Format Setting

data.name: CheckPasswordFormatFailure.Text
data.value: The setting passwordFormat is not set to Hashed in web.config - consider editing web.config and setting it to Hashed (or use the configuration manager). More information can be found here.

data.name: CheckPasswordFormatReason.Text
data.value: If the value is Clear or Encrypters, hacker can retrieve password from user's password from database.

data.name: CheckPasswordFormatSuccess.Text
data.value: The passwordFormat is set as Hashed in web.config

data.name: CheckAllowableFileExtensionsFailure.Text
data.value: Either aspx, asp or php files were found in allowable file extensions setting. This will allow hackers to upload code. Remove these extensions at Settings > More > More security settings > Allowable File Extensions

data.name: CheckAllowableFileExtensionsName.Text
data.value: Check if there are any harmful extensions allowed by the file uploader

data.name: CheckAllowableFileExtensionsReason.Text
data.value: Either aspx, asp or php files were found in allowable file extensions setting. This will allow hackers to upload code. Remove these extensions at Settings > More > More security settings > Allowable File Extensions

data.name: CheckAllowableFileExtensionsSuccess.Text
data.value: The allowable file extensions is setup correctly.

data.name: CheckFileExists.Error
data.value: Current SQL Server account can execute xp_fileexist which can detect whether files exist on server.

data.name: CheckSqlRiskFailure.Text
data.value: The current SQL connection can execute dangerous command(s) on your SQL Server.

data.name: CheckSqlRiskName.Text
data.value: Check Current SQL Account Permission

data.name: CheckSqlRiskReason.Text
data.value: If the SQL Server account isn't configured properly, it may leave risk and hackers can exploit the server by running special script.

data.name: CheckSqlRiskSuccess.Text
data.value: The SQL Server account configured correctly.

data.name: ExecuteCommand.Error
data.value: Current SQL Server account can execute xp_cmdshell which will running command line in sql server system.

data.name: GetFolderTree.Error
data.value: Current SQL Server account can execute xp_dirtree which can see the server's folders structure.

data.name: RegRead.Error
data.value: Current SQL Server account can read registry values. You need to check the permissions of xp_regread, xp_regwrite, xp_regenumkeys, xp_regenumvalues, xp_regdeletekey, xp_regdeletekey, xp_regdeletevalue, xp_instance_regread, xp_instance_regwrite, xp_instance_regenumkeys, xp_instance_regenumvalues, xp_instance_regdeletekey, xp_instance_regdeletekey, xp_instance_regdeletevalue stored procedures.

data.name: SysAdmin.Error
data.value: Current SQL Server account is 'sysadmin'.
